messages.subject: Re: Mathematician Erik Demaine
messages.msgSnippet: Suzanne, It never occurred to me that someone could actually make a living being a mathematician specializing in origami.  It s certainly nothing I saw listed
messages.messageBody:
Suzanne,

It never occurred to me that someone could actually make a living
being a mathematician specializing in origami. It's certainly
nothing I saw listed in the college catalog at the college I
attended! Anyway, it was news to me, but very cool, I thought!
Amazing what people can do when they make it up as they go!

Cindy

--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, "Suzanne Ackerson"
<sylvanv@a...> wrote:
> Cindy,
>
> Thank you, thank you for the article about mathematician Erik
Demaine!! This is perfect for my almost 11 yo son. He's been
folding origami for three years and has some of the same interests
as Erik.
>
> Take care,
> Suzanne
> ----- Original Message -----

> Forgive me if you've read this already, but I found this
inspiring:
>
> An interview with home-educated mathematician Erik
> Demaine:
>
> http://www.newscientist.com/opinion/opinterview.jsp?id=ns23781

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re:  Mathematician Erik Demaine
messages.msgSnippet: Cindy, Thank you, thank you for the article about mathematician Erik Demaine!!  This is perfect for my almost 11 yo son.  He s been folding origami for three
messages.messageBody:
Cindy,

Thank you, thank you for the article about mathematician Erik Demaine!! This is perfect for my almost 11 yo son. He's been folding origami for three years and has some of the same interests as Erik.

Take care,
Suzanne
----- Original Message -----
From: cindyjsowers <cindyjsowers@...>
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, January 20, 2003 3:16 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Mathematician Erik Demaine


Forgive me if you've read this already, but I found this inspiring:

An interview with home-educated mathematician Erik
Demaine:

http://www.newscientist.com/opinion/opinterview.jsp?id=ns23781
